metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33621 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The cgi gem before 0.1.0.2, 0.2.x before 0.2.2, and 0.3.x before 0.3.5 for Ruby allows HTTP response splitting. This is relevant to applications that use untrusted user input either to generate an HTTP response or to create a CGI::Cookie object.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33621` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.16+esm4
ruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.16+esm4
ruby2.3-tcltk - 2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.16+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jruby package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
ruby2.3 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.16+esm4').
